actions.committee: House Committee on Economic and Educational Opportunities
actions.text: Referred to the House Committee on Economic and Educational Opportunities.

actions.in_committee: House Committee on Economic and Educational Opportunities
actions.text: Referred to the Subcommittee on Employer-Employee Relations.

official_title: To amend the Employee Retirement Income Security Act of 1974 to provide continued participation under a defined benefit plan to employees who are terminated from employment within seven years of attaining normal retirement age under the plan.

summary.text: Continued Participation Pension Act of 1996 - Amends the Employee Retirement Income Security Act of 1974 (ERISA) to provide for continued participation under a defined benefit plan for employees who are terminated from employment within seven years of attaining normal retirement age under the plan.

titles.title: To amend the Employee Retirement Income Security Act of 1974 to provide continued participation under a defined benefit plan to employees who are terminated from employment within seven years of attaining normal retirement age under the plan.
